text:
Apart from the HTTP Request Defaults not being picked up - neither are the 
authorizations given in the manager. This makes Jmeter useless for testing my 
application. 

Also the webservices (SOAP etc) control will not use default authorizations (or 
indeed allow a user/password to be entered in order to retrieve wsdl).
creator: simon.beaumont@biowisdom.com

text:
I honestly haven't come across a WSDL that required authentication. I will take 
a look and see if I can add that in the next few weeks. Changing status to 
enhancement, since the behavior is as designed and isn't a bug. By default most 
webservices toolkits do not require authentication to read the WSDL.
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com

text:
I have downloaded the wsdl and made this available as a file URL - 
unfortunately this (prefectly valid since we have been generating axis and .net 
stubs for months) doesn't work... nothing in the logs as to what is going on... 
BTW why are you not using axis for SOAP?
creator: simon.beaumont@biowisdom.com
woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
the only reason is when I wrote the sampler originally Axis had not been 
released yet. It's on my life of things to do when I get the motivation, since 
Axis is better. the only reason it hasn't changed is purely laziness. The wsdl 
functionality is very primitive and isn't a full blown WSDL driver either. that 
is why it can't handle authentication. Again, this is due to my own experience, 
since most of the webservices stuff I've worked on was either public or 
internal. which means authentication isn't an issue. thanks for posting the 
bug, I will take a look and see if there's an easy fix temporarily. I may not 
have time to change it to use Axis, since the API is quite different.

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I pass the AuthManager from the GUI to the WSDLHelper class now. Hopefully it 
will work. I tested it against IIS and Axis generated WSDL without 
authentication and the existing functionality is still working. If you're still 
having problems, please re-open the bug and attach the exception you're getting.
